statement: You are given an array of integers a_1, a_2, ..., a_n and two integers s and x. Count the number of subsegments of the array whose sum of elements equals s and whose maximum value equals x.More formally, count the number of pairs 1 â‰¤q l â‰¤q r â‰¤q n such that: a_l + a_{l + 1} + ... + a_r = s. \max(a_l, a_{l + 1}, ..., a_r) = x.
input_specification: InputEach test consists of multiple test cases. The first line contains a single integer t (1 â‰¤q t â‰¤q 10^4)Â â€” the number of test cases. The description of the test cases follows.The first line of each test case contains three integers n, s, and x (1 â‰¤q n â‰¤q 2 Â· 10^5, -2 Â· 10^{14} â‰¤q s â‰¤q 2 Â· 10^{14}, -10^9 â‰¤q x â‰¤q 10^9). The second line of each test case contains n integers a_1, a_2, ..., a_n (-10^9 â‰¤q a_i â‰¤q 10^9).It is guaranteed that the sum of n across all test cases does not exceed 2 Â· 10^5.
output_specification: OutputFor each test case, output the number of subsegments of the array whose sum of elements equals s and whose maximum value equals x.
